definition: good and bad/most unfortunate occurrence/in any case/whatever
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
bad/wicked/evil/Kangxi radical 78
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
no matter what may happen (idiom)

sentences.english: Well, anyhow, I rang the bell.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，不管好歹，反正我按铃了。

sentences.english: It seems out of harmony, someway, with the beauty and promise of the day.
sentences.chinese: 似乎出和谐，好歹，与美丽的诺言一天。

sentences.english: There should be someway to manage same items coming in different sizes and colors.
sentences.chinese: 应该好歹来管理不同的大小和颜色相同的物品来。

sentences.english: In fact, he often changes girlfriend, for he doesn't know chalk from cheese.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，他经常换女友，因为他不知好歹。

sentences.english: You are an ungrateful nephew and you will not get anything…
sentences.chinese: 你是一个不知好歹的侄子，你什么也别想得到。

sentences.english: Thank goodness, it is still a bill worth passing.
sentences.chinese: 谢天谢地，好歹这是个值得通过的法案。

sentences.english: It is a mistake to lavish kindness to ungrateful people.
sentences.chinese: 对不知好歹的人释以善意是愚蠢的。

sentences.english: Make the eyes of Mo inside profoundly very thick disappointment, for this person of stubborn.
sentences.chinese: 弄墨的眼里透出浓浓的失望，对于这个人的不知好歹。

sentences.english: You yourself are able to infer your destiny without seeking help from the future teller.
sentences.chinese: 你必须能自行推断命运的好歹，而不需算命师。

sentences.english: With dumplings more or less conquered, I moved on to the chicken and tofu.
sentences.chinese: 饺子这关好歹算是过了，我开始转攻鸡肉和豆腐。

sentences.english: Discoverer of the Fountain of Youth.
sentences.chinese: 好歹也是“发现不老泉的人”耶。

sentences.english: You were kind enough to let me spend the night, so I do not mean to sound ungrateful.
sentences.chinese: 你们好心留我过夜，所以我不想说些不知好歹的话。

sentences.english: He demanded irritably . You were schooled in Europe and America.
sentences.chinese: 他生气地大吼，您好歹是在欧洲，在美国受过教育的。

definition: at the minimum/at the very least

to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides

otherwise/or else/or
at most/at best
must/have to/be bound to
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
though/although
at long last/finally/on the whole
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
eventually/after all/anyhow
granted that/even if
if it were not for/but for
